desc:
The third mechsuit iteration. Installed with an ultra-high-strength alloy frame, it can take down foes with its attacks faster than two shakes of a wolf's tail.
Obtainable from capsule machines in the city.

The fourth mechsuit iteration. It features souped-up joints that allow for combat and ease of movement through even difficult terrain such as mountain ranges or jungles.
Obtainable from capsule machines in the city.

The seventh mechsuit iteration. Suited for when air superiority is a mission's primary goal, its ultra-light metallic frame enables mid-air guided attacks in any situation.
Obtainable from capsule machines in the city.

The tenth mechsuit iteration. A mass-produced model with few flaws, its ease of use and balance between power and defense has made it quite popular.
Obtainable from capsule machines in the city.

The fifth mechsuit iteration. Geared for excellent defense, it moves slightly slower, but can completely neutralize enemy weapon attacks.
Obtainable from capsule machines in the city.

The first mechsuit iteration. A prototype equipped with a state-of-the-art optical brain, it can be remotely controlled and unmanned for a short time.
A super rare capsule that can be obtained from capsule machines in the city.

When startled or wary, these owls' fluffy bodies have a habit of shrinking, which can be very cute.
Obtainable from a Zoshigaya-exclusive capsule machine.

The world's largest owl. It owes much of its large size to its fluffy feathers and long tail.
Obtainable from a Zoshigaya-exclusive capsule machine.

Measuring less than a foot tall even when fully grown, these owls are often kept as pets.
Obtainable from a Zoshigaya-exclusive capsule machine.

The smallest of the owls that can be found in Japan. Its feathers stand up straight and look like cute ears.
Obtainable from a Zoshigaya-exclusive capsule machine.

Usually alone or in pairs, these owls live in groups in the winter. They're adorable when cuddling together to sleep.
Obtainable from a Zoshigaya-exclusive capsule machine.

An owl with feathers as white and fluffy as snow. Popular for its tendency to make a laughter-like expression.
A super rare capsule obtainable from a Zoshigaya-exclusive capsule machine.

Shichi-kun loves to go for walks with everyone.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

With those cool sunglasses, Shichi-kun's giving off a slightly more mature vibe.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

Shichi-kun is always in a good mood, but sometimes he gets a bit carried away.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

Shichi-kun loves Boom Bang Burger.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

Even the energetic Shichi-kun needs time to refresh.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

Strapped to a set of vibrant balloons, Shichi-kun helps make Shibuya's skyline even more colorful.
A super rare capsule obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

The zookeeper decided to play a little prank on Capy B., who had fallen asleep in the bath. Clementines are Capy B.'s favorite food.
Obtainable from a Shinjuku-exclusive capsule machine.

The zookeeper decided to play a little prank on Capy B., who had fallen asleep in the bath. The fresh scent of yuzu enhances relaxation.
Obtainable from a Shinjuku-exclusive capsule machine.

The zookeeper decided to play a little prank on Capy B., who had fallen asleep in the bath. Capy B. doesn't mind the smell of durian.
Obtainable from a Shinjuku-exclusive capsule machine.

The zookeeper decided to play a little prank on Capy B., who had fallen asleep in the bath. The ducklings relax here, too.
Obtainable from a Shinjuku-exclusive capsule machine.

The zookeeper decided to play a little prank on Capy B., who had fallen asleep in the bath. The warmth of the bath even caused the cat to fall asleep.
Obtainable from a Shinjuku-exclusive capsule machine.

Capy B.'s family is very tight-knit. They're always together, even in the bath.
A super rare capsule. Obtainable from a Shinjuku-exclusive capsule machine.

A Bake-danuki is a yokai that loves alcohol. Could it be that some people who often drink alcohol are actually not human at all...?
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

A yokai that loves pranks. They exist to laugh at the sight of humans they fluster and terrorize.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

A yokai taking a child's form. He pretends to be a lost child and uses his single big eye to scare humans.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

A yokai lurking in the sea. Often appearing in the water at night, they suddenly manifest and sink passing boats.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

The Inari Fox are messengers of the gods of the harvest. They kindly watch over people who work diligently.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

A transformed elderly cat. They have two tails and can reportedly speak human language.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

A kitsune's wedding is said to be an omen of good fortune. Humans who witness it may be blessed with good luck.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

A shy yokai said to bring good fortune to homes. You can only see one in childhood. Perhaps you've encountered one in the past.
A super rare capsule obtainable from capsule machines around the city.

Not only does The Red Panther feature a sleek, red body, a lightweight undercarriage, and a turbo engine, but it also comes outfitted with hyper-realistic cat-ear-shaped headlights.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

Its exceptionally air-resistant body makes even the sharpest cornering look like child's play.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

While its above-average weight causes slower acceleration compared to other tanks, its strongest weapon is the power to push forward in any terrain.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

Its charmingly-large tailfins provide this tank with the highest maneuverability in the series.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

Using its thick front armor as its source of power, it can blast away any tanks that dare approach it.
Obtainable at capsule machines around the city.

As the only tank in the series equipped with a high-tech core, it can easily achieve victory using precise, AI-driven operation.
A super rare capsule obtainable from capsule machines around the city.

Shichi-kun signals the start of the parade with a lively beat on a drum that echoes throughout Shibuya.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

Everyone, look! It's a bird, it's a planeâ€”no, it's Shichi-kun drawing a rainbow in the sky above Shibuya!
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

A fantastic magic show from Shichi-kun... What will he pull out of his hat to amaze the crowd?
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

Dressed as a bright-eyed and bushy-tailed clown, Shichi-kun puts the crowd in high spirits.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

My, what big ears and nose you have, Shichi-kun... Has the beast tamer has become the beast and joined the parade?
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

Hm? That's strange... Looks like Shichi-kun's stuck behind some sort of invisible wall.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

With a skillful jump though rings of fire, Shichi-kun shows the crowd you can do anything you put your mind to.
Obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

The parade has led to the big top, where Shichi-kun waits, tail wagging at the thought of bringing a smile to everyone's faces with more circus acts.
A super rare capsule obtainable from a Shibuya-exclusive capsule machine.

The fashionista of Sushi Village. In their glamorous attire, they shine like no other.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

A hard and diligent worker with a hearty body.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

Beneath their shy demeanor is a gentle and kind soul.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

A surprisingly popular villager, despite their efforts to stay tightly wrapped.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

The sweetheart of Sushi Village, their bright personality always lights up the room.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

A cut above the rest, they act mature but can feel uneasy at times.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

The very approachable and ever attentive mayor's assistant.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

One of the landmark buildings in Sushi Village. It features orange walls with beautiful patterns and plenty of space for the villagers and their catches.
A super rare capsule obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

Hearing someone sobbing in the kitchenette, the Red Office Hero pops in to help dry their tears over a nice, hot cup of tea.
Obtainable from a capsule machine in the city.

Surrounded on all sides by messy stacks of paperwork? Call on the Blue Office Hero to come to the rescue.
Obtainable from a capsule machine in the city.

Error windows flood the screen. The computer freezes. Your data could be corrupted... Never fear, for the Green Office Hero is here.
Obtainable from a capsule machine in the city.

New to the job, the Yellow Office Hero is still learning the ropes but will do all they can to lend a helping hand.
Obtainable from a capsule machine in the city.

The Pink Office Hero provides unbeatable backup with their incredible insight and impeccable organization.
Obtainable from a capsule machine in the city.

Always serious yet well respected, the dependable Gray Office Exec has led the team to success on numerous occasions.
A super rare capsule obtainable from capsule machines around the city.

A small crab darting out stands no chance at breaking Capy B.'s cool composure.
It almost looks like Capy B. has eight ears with this crab hat on...
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

This squishy jellyfish hat is stuck like jelly on Capy B.'s head.
The round parts around the jellyfish's bell make it look like Capy B. is wearing a nightcap. I'm sure he'll have good dreams tonight.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

Even a yellow pineapple-like hat looks great on Capy B.
His self-confidence is infectious and brings a smile to the faces of the zoo's guests feel happy as well.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

This simple pattern with blue and white stripes is popular for its power to change up a look. Even Capy B. is tilting his head as if something about himself feels different...
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

Breaded and deep-fried shrimp: a beloved and tasty treat.
Perhaps Capy B.'s new look will whet the appetites of the zoo's guests?
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

Capy B.'s new octopus hat could easily be mistaken for a red bandana.
That is, until you notice the cute, little eyes on the side.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

Even Capy B. can't resist the allure of sweet, sweet ice cream.
With the headwear's crisp cone and a nice dollop of whipped cream on top, some of the zoo's guests have begun to drool...
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.

It looks like Capy B. has finally been given his well-deserved crown for being the most popular animal at the zoo.
Though he can't have a soak with it on, he looks pleased all the same.
Obtainable from a Kichijoji-exclusive capsule machine.
